messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning]Living Joyfully with Children
messages.msgSnippet: ... It s one of my all-time favorite parenting books, one I give as gifts and recommend to new homeschoolers and new parents. Tuck
messages.messageBody:
>
>
>My question is has anyone else read this book and what
>were your thoughts on it.
>

It's one of my all-time favorite parenting books, one I give as gifts
and recommend to new homeschoolers and new parents.

Tuck

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Living Joyfully with Children
messages.msgSnippet: I recently came across a book I read about two years ago called Living Joyfully with Children by Winn and Bill Sweet.  I remember at the time thinking they
messages.messageBody:
I recently came across a book I read about two years
ago called Living Joyfully with Children by Winn and
Bill Sweet. I remember at the time thinking they were
a bit wacked, but now as I flip through the book and
look at my notes some of it makes some sense, but some
stuff I am not so sure.

My question is has anyone else read this book and what
were your thoughts on it.

Leslie
>

messages.subject: Brer Terrypin
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/23/02 7:01:14 AM Central Daylight Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/23/02 7:01:14 AM Central Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Terrypin runs (he runs with his snout stretched way up
high and his funny legs stuck way out) to greet Roy
and me. >>

Aaaaw, how cute Sharon! We have a VERY large snapping turtle that loves the
pool at the end of the drainage pipe, on the edge of our woods. He does not
love us the way Brer loves you guys, but he's fun to watch. We've dubbed him
"Big Mo".

Ren
